meanings.definition: To say or write something as a comment or observation.
meanings.sent1: She remarked on the beautiful flowers in the garden.
meanings.sent2: He always remarks on the weather when we meet.
meanings.sent3: The cat remarked on the empty food bowl with a meow.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes remarked on the sadness hidden behind his smile.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's remark on the student's progress was encouraging.

meanings.definition: To mention or comment on something briefly.
meanings.sent1: He remarked about the new book he read.
meanings.sent2: She often remarks about the latest news updates.
meanings.sent3: The bird remarked on the passing clouds with a chirp.
meanings.sent4: His silence remarked more than any words could.
meanings.sent5: The chef's remark on the dish's flavor was unexpected.

meanings.definition: To make a comment or observation.
meanings.sent1: They remarked on the interesting movie they watched.
meanings.sent2: She remarks on the changes in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The child remarked on the funny shape of the clouds.
meanings.sent4: His actions remarked on his true intentions.
meanings.sent5: The scientist's remark on the experiment's results was insightful.
